definition.name: GitHub Action for GraalVM
definition.description: Set up a specific version of the GraalVM JDK and add the command-line tools to the PATH
definition.author: GraalVM Community

inputs.name: java-version
inputs.description: Java version. See examples of supported syntax in the README file.

inputs.name: java-package
inputs.description: The package type (jdk or jdk+fx). Currently applies to Liberica only.

inputs.name: distribution
inputs.description: GraalVM distribution. See the list of available distributions in the README file.

inputs.name: components
inputs.description: Comma-separated list of GraalVM components to be installed.

inputs.name: github-token
inputs.description: Set it to secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN to increase rate limits when accessing the GitHub API. Defaults to github.token.

inputs.name: set-java-home
inputs.description: Set $JAVA_HOME to the GraalVM installation. Default: true.

inputs.name: cache
inputs.description: Name of the build platform to cache dependencies. It can be "maven", "gradle", or "sbt".

inputs.name: check-for-updates
inputs.description: Annotate jobs with update notifications, for example, when a new GraalVM release is available

inputs.name: native-image-musl
inputs.description: Set up musl for static image building with GraalVM Native Image.

inputs.name: native-image-job-reports
inputs.description: Post a job summary containing a Native Image build report.

inputs.name: native-image-pr-reports
inputs.description: Post a comment containing a Native Image build report on pull requests.

inputs.name: native-image-pr-reports-update-existing
inputs.description: Instead of posting another comment, update an existing PR comment with the latest Native Image build report.

inputs.name: native-image-enable-sbom
inputs.description: Automatically generate an SBOM and submit it to the GitHub dependency submission API for vulnerability and dependency tracking.

inputs.name: gds-token
inputs.description: Download token for the GraalVM Download Service. If provided, the action will set up GraalVM Enterprise Edition.

outputs.name: cache-hit
outputs.description: A boolean value to indicate an exact match was found for the primary key

evidence.reasoning: This action sets up a specific version of the GraalVM JDK, which is essential for managing dependencies in Java projects and is also relevant for building applications. Additionally, it modifies the environment to include command-line tools, which relates to infrastructure setup.
